about.title: About
about.description: An evolving and truely open 3D studio for making and optimizing VRM avatars and/or create a customized avatar builder app using your own assets.

Developers/Contexts/audio-context.title: Audio Context
Developers/Contexts/audio-context.description: Audio Context is used simply to enable or disable audio.

Developers/Contexts/language-context.title: Language Context
Developers/Contexts/language-context.description: Language context that uses react-i18next to translate given text.

Developers/Contexts/scene-context.title: Scene Context
Developers/Contexts/scene-context.description: Scene Context allows easy access to app managers and scene elements. All the logic to modify, edit, display, create spritesheet or lora for vrms rest within these managers, and using Scene Context is an easy way to fetch all the logic:

Developers/Contexts/sound-context.title: Sound Context
Developers/Contexts/sound-context.description: Sound Context is used to get sound files and play them in any page or component by just providing the name of the sound.

Developers/Contexts/view-context.title: View Context
Developers/Contexts/view-context.description: Allows navigation within the app and current active page. Viewmode just defines which page is currently active:

Developers/Managers/animation-manager.title: Animation Manager
Developers/Managers/animation-manager.description: Manages animations for a character, including loading, playing, and controlling animations.

Developers/Managers/blink-manager.title: Blink Manager
Developers/Managers/blink-manager.description: BlinkManager is a class responsible for managing blinking animations for VRM models in a Three.js scene.

Developers/Managers/character-manager.title: Character Manager
Developers/Managers/character-manager.description: Character Manager is the main manager for the character studio, it provides functions to load manifests and traits within your three.js application

Developers/Managers/look-at-manager.title: LookAt Manager
Developers/Managers/look-at-manager.description: LookAtManager is a class that manages the orientation of joints or bones in a Three.js scene, typically used for eyes and neck of a character, following the mouse movement within a defined hotzone.

Developers/Managers/lora-data-generator.title: LoRa Data Generator
Developers/Managers/lora-data-generator.description: The LoRaDataGenerator class is responsible for generating LoRa data based on the specified manifest file.

Developers/Managers/screenshot-manager.title: Screenshot Manager
Developers/Managers/screenshot-manager.description: ScreenshotManager is responsible for capturing screenshots with various framing options within a Three.js scene.

Developers/Managers/sprite-atlas-generat.title: Sprite Atlas Generator
Developers/Managers/sprite-atlas-generat.description: SpriteAtlasGenerator is a class responsible for generating sprite atlases from animations specified in a manifest file.

Developers/overview.title: Overview
Developers/overview.description: Character Studio aims to give a quick setup to any character generator. Logic lies within Scripts and Managers that have been externalized to be reusable. The react app initializes these managers within a SceneContext to be quickly imported and accessed in any React Page or React Component.

Developers/Pages/appearance.title: Appearance
Developers/Pages/appearance.description: To Access this menu, go to Create Character menu button, then select any option displayed there.

Developers/Pages/batch-download.title: Batch Download
Developers/Pages/batch-download.description: To Access this menu, go to Batch Download button, then select any other option than is not Manifest - Load by manifest

Developers/Pages/batch-manifest.title: Batch Manifest
Developers/Pages/batch-manifest.description: To Access this menu, go to Batch Download button, then Manifest - Load by manifest

Developers/Pages/bio.title: Bio
Developers/Pages/bio.description: This menu is currently hidden, to display it you can use the function setViewMode and const ViewMode from ViewContext import statement, to display this page usingsetViewMode(ViewMode.LANDING)

Developers/Pages/claim.title: Claim
Developers/Pages/claim.description: Claim displays the menu options for batch download processes. It's the second menu element that goes by name Batch Download in the Landing page options.

Developers/Pages/create.title: Create
Developers/Pages/create.description: Create can be accessed by clicking the first Menu Button in the Landing page

Developers/Pages/landing.title: Landing
Developers/Pages/landing.description: The Landing component page is the initial page. It provides the user with options to create, optimize, load a character or connect wallet. Each option is represented by a button.

Developers/Pages/load.title: Load
Developers/Pages/load.description: (wip) The Load page is currently hidden, but should be accessible from the Landing page to allow user quickly load their saved characters.

Developers/Pages/mint.title: Mint
Developers/Pages/mint.description: (wip) The Mint Page is currently hidden, but should be accessed after user finished creating his character from the appearance menu.

Developers/Pages/optimizer.title: Optimizer
Developers/Pages/optimizer.description: You can access this page by going to Optimize Character menu button.

Developers/Pages/save.title: Save
Developers/Pages/save.description: The Save component is a part of a React application that provides a user interface for saving a character. It includes buttons for going back, merging options, exporting, and minting. The component also interacts with several contexts to manage view modes, language, sound, and audio settings.

Developers/Pages/view.title: View
Developers/Pages/view.description: This menu is currently hidden, but it can be shown after character bio page, after the personality of the character has been selected.

Developers/Pages/wallet.title: Wallet
Developers/Pages/wallet.description: (WIP) For the connect wallet button to appear, you need to setup an open sea api key in the .env, the variable must be called with the name VITEOPENSEAKEY. Once a key is placed, you can access this menu, in the main window. it will request you to connect your wallet.

General/create-an-avatar.title: Create an Avatar
General/create-an-avatar.description: There's a few ways to make an avatar with Character Studio:

General/optimize-avatars.title: Optimize avatars
General/optimize-avatars.description: Optimizing VRM models by hand can be very tedious and time consuming. We have designed a simple drag and drop solution that can reduce the amount of draw calls and overall filesize of VRM avatars by:

history.title: History
history.description: This project stands on the shoulders of giants with years of history from open source hackers and web3 enthusiasts.

Modders/getting-started.title: Getting Started with Manifest Files
Modders/getting-started.description: This guide will help you set up your first character collection for Character Studio. We'll walk through creating a manifest file that tells the studio how to display and organize your 3D models, textures, and other assets.

Modders/manifest-files/ai-personalities.title: AI Personality
Modders/manifest-files/ai-personalities.description: This is an experimental feature for prepopulating and customizing personalities for VRM avatars for AI chatbot application use cases.

Modders/manifest-files/character-animati.title: Character animations
Modders/manifest-files/character-animati.description: There are 2 ways to add animations to characters:

Modders/manifest-files/character-select.title: Character Select
Modders/manifest-files/character-select.description: There's a manifest.json file for the character select screen located in the public folder of the repo, for example CharacterStudio/public/character-assets/manifest.json. Think of each of these as a new character template, like picking a class in an MMO or choosing your fighter in a video game.

Modders/manifest-files/character-traits.title: Character Traits
Modders/manifest-files/character-traits.description: Setting up this manifest will populate the asset trait section with your own traits that people can select from. It will also serve the character studio for cull trait model options (remove faces underneath) based on the layers, so the triangles disappear underneath the clothing for example.

Modders/manifest-files/generate-manifest.title: Useful Scripts
Modders/manifest-files/generate-manifest.description: Some useful scripts for generating manifest files for use in https://github.com/M3-org/characterstudio. YMMV.

Modders/manifest-files/overview.title: Overview
Modders/manifest-files/overview.description: The manifest files are essential if you want to mod Character Studio with your own assets and selection screens. They are found in various parts of the project, and basically are the main file other than art assets that you would need to modify to make an avatar builder program. For more info go to the full documentation page for any manifest in the sidebar.

Modders/manifest-files/vrm-to-lora.title: VRM to LoRA data
Modders/manifest-files/vrm-to-lora.description: This manifest is inspired by the VRM to LoRA guide by reneil1337 will generate training data that can be used for training LoRAs using tools such as Kohya.

Modders/manifest-files/vrm-to-spriteshee.title: VRM to Spritesheet
Modders/manifest-files/vrm-to-spriteshee.description: The spritesheet generator works very similar to the LoRA generator with the exception that the image outputs are turned into an atlas alongside a gif preview. Here's a very simple example of a manifest file that can generate a spritesheet:

Modders/manifest-files/vrm-to-thumbnails.title: VRM to Thumbnails
Modders/manifest-files/vrm-to-thumbnails.description: The thumbnails generator allows you to create thumbnails with the assets that will be  loaded in each trait group.

Modders/process-avatars.title: Preparing Assets
Modders/process-avatars.description: After cloning and installing Character Studio, you will want to then copy your assets into the public folder and check the .env variable to ensure it's configured to the right location.
